com.adneom.test.quentin

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adneom.test.quentin.Solver

  • class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that solves the following problem: Write a function "partition" that takes one parameter "list" and one parameter "size" which returns a list containing multiple sublists with a maximum of "size" elements
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    quentin bernet

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> list
      List to explode according to the size
      private java.lang.Integer size
      Size of the several sublists which will compose the solution
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> solution
      Final list containing the sublists representing the solution

      Constructor and Description
      Solver()
      Constructor of the solver

      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> partition(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> list, java.lang.Integer size)
      Solver catching the exceptions and calling the recursive algorithm that updates the solution
      private void recursiveAlgorithm(java.lang.Integer lowerBound, java.lang.Integer upperBound)
      Solves and updates the private variable solution by dividing the given list to multiple sublists with "size" size

    • Method Detail

      • partition

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> partition(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> list,
                                                                            java.lang.Integer size)
                                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Solver catching the exceptions and calling the recursive algorithm that updates the solution
        Parameters:
        list - list to explode according to the size
        size - max size of the several sublists which will compose the solution
        Returns:
        updated solution
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if list is null or list is empty or size is negative

      • recursiveAlgorithm

        private void recursiveAlgorithm(java.lang.Integer lowerBound,
                                java.lang.Integer upperBound)
        Solves and updates the private variable solution by dividing the given list to multiple sublists with "size" size
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - start index of the next sublist (at start, it equals 0)
        upperBound - end index of the next sublist (at start, it equals size)
